Figure 3:Motivation for variance-aware representation alignment.(a)In thelow-variance regime, the alignment loss remains consistently low on a pretrained model from REPA(Yuet al.,2024), indicating a learnable and informative supervision signal.
In contrast, in thehigh-variance regime, the loss stays high, reflecting the ill-posed nature of semantic recovery from noise.(b)Restricting representation alignment to thelow-variance regimeyields the best FID, while applying it only in thehigh-variance regimeprovides minimal meaningful improvement over the baseline.
These results indicate that representation alignment should be activated adaptively rather than uniformly along the diffusion trajectory.
